contentrichtext.text: [[File:Jonan in Kumamoto Prefecture.png|thumb|right|Location of Jōnan in Kumamoto]] {{nihongo|'''Jōnan'''|城南町|Jōnan-machi}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Shimomashiki District, Kumamoto|Shimomashiki District]], [[Kumamoto Prefecture|Kumamoto]], [[Japan]]. On March 23, 2010 Jōnan, along with the town of [[Ueki, Kumamoto|Ueki]], from [[Kamoto District, Kumamoto|Kamoto District]], was merged into the expanded [[Kumamoto, Kumamoto|city of Kumamoto]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]].<ref name="Kumamotomerges">"[http://www.kokudo.or.jp/marge/kumamoto.html 都道府県別市町村変更情報：福岡]." ''kokudo.or.jp''. Retrieved on November 22, 2008.</ref> As of April 1, 2012, the area is part of the [[Minami-ku, Kumamoto|Minami-ku ward]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 19,885 and the [[population density|density]] of 539.18 persons per km². The total area was 36.88 km². The town is the home of the [[Kumamoto Civil Astronomical Observatory]] and the namesake of [[Meanings of asteroid names (21001-22000)|asteroid 21254]]. ==Notes and references== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.city.kumamoto.kumamoto.jp/ Kumamoto City official website] {{ja icon}} {{coord|32|42|N|130|43|E|region:JP_type:city|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jonan, Kumamoto}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kumamoto Prefecture]] [[Category:Kumamoto, Kumamoto]] {{Kumamoto-geo-stub}}
